issue.title: Update LengthFieldBasedFrameDecoder.java

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.title: Length field based frame decoder can be optimized

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

LengthFieldBasedFrameDecoder. decode(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, ByteBuf in) method，Can be optimized -So we keep frameLengthInt in instance variable to avoid unnecessary calculations , When there is not enough data in the buffer, current data frame's frameLength does not need to be recalculated at the next decoding.

Modification:

Add an instance variable to avoid unnecessary calculations ： private int frameLengthInt = -1

Result:

Fixes #12171.

body:
First off, thanks for making and maintaining Netty. Don't take it as a complaint but as a heads up.

This is a braking change. It regresses expected behaviour of the LengthFieldBasedFrameDecoder.

The `protected long getUnadjustedFrameLength(ByteBuf buf, int offset, int length, ByteOrder order)` is marked `protected` it is deemed a point of extension and therefore is a part of the public API. Nothing in the documentation of the method states what behaviour should be expected by the implementors i.e. whether it  is expected to be called once or multiple times. However, prior to the change it was invoked multiple time. As such it is now (was) part of the expected, albeit undocumented, behaviour. 

I have an ASN1 frame decoder, that broker after a recent upgrade that I traced to this change.  ASN1 allows frames of be variable length, the length field itself is variable width. Prior to the change, if the buffer contained partial frame that truncated the length filed, it was possible to first return a frame length that would ensure enough bytes were read to decode the length header. With a subsequent call to the `getUnadjustedFrameLength` decoding a full frame length. I.e. it was possible to progressively decode the length of the frame. After the change this is no-longer possible.

Not a show stopper, but I can no-longer use provided LengthFieldBasedFrameDecoder.

Cheers!

> 

maybe you can revert  frameLengthInt  to -1 ，read your new frame , But at the moment, there is no such mechanism，you can override getUnadjustedFrameLength  and revert frameLengthInt  to -1 .  make frameLengthInt  property to protected?

I've decided that I will override `protected Object decode(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, ByteBuf in) throws Exception` instead and re-use as much of the base class as possible. However most of the static utility methods are private so it makes it hard.

If you decide to keep the change, it may be worth updating the documentation to let folks know what is the expected behaviour of the protected methods in the class.
@normanmaurer man，I've added an method that allows users to repeatedly read frames by overwriting getUnadjustedFrameLength

issue.title: LengthFieldBasedFrameDecoder allow repeat read frame

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Not long ago, I have modified the LengthFieldBasedFrameDecoder class to skip frames of parsed, however, we should be allowed to repeat reading frame, to meet their business expansion

Modification:

add resetFrameLengthInt method to reset resetFrameLengthInt  variable

Result:

Fixes #12171.
